frame.name: Meet_specifications
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen> becomes sufficient enough to meet a <fen>Standard</fen>. Alternatively, an action or occurrence can be thought of as <fen>Event</fen> that fulfills a <fen>Standard</fen>. In this frame, the <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen>, or <fen>Event</fen> can be conceptualized as being on a scale where a change of value or circumstances brings it in line with the position of the <fen>Standard</fen> on the scale. <ex><fex name="Entity">This paper</fex> does not <t>meet</t> <fex name="Standard">the requirements for graduation</fex>.</ex> <ex>Will <fex name="Agent">Ben</fex> <t>fulfill</t> <fex name="Standard">his obligation to Margaret </fex>?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The intentional <fen>Agent</fen> acts to meet to a <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The non-intentional <fen>Entity</fen> becomes sufficient enough to meet a <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>An act or occurence that changes circumstances sufficiently so as to meet a <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Standard
FE.definition: <def-root>A condition or requirement that the <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen>, or <fen>Event</fen> attempt to meet.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen> become sufficient in regards to the <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen> become sufficient in regards in to the <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen>, or <fen>Event</fen> becomes sufficient in regards to the <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Standard</fen> is exceeded or not by <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen> or <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: meet.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to satisfy a condition or requirement

lexUnit.name: fulfill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: satisfy or meet a requirement (or condition)
